A data lake is an approach to storing data in its native format for organizational use. It is an essential tool for storing structured and unstructured data on the cloud. You can create a data lake for your organization using Object Storage.

Here are the steps to create a schema and tables: To create a schema: 1. Go to Databases. 2. Select the database in which you want to create a schema. 3. Click Create schema. 4. Type a name for the schema. 5. Specify the retention time interval (in days) for the schema. 6. Click Create. To create a table: 1. Log in to IBM® watsonx.data console. 2. From the navigation menu, select Data manager. 3. Select the engine from the Engine menu. Catalogs that are associated with the selected engine are listed. 4. Click Create and select Create table. 5. In the Create table form, drag a file to the box or click to upload. 6. Click the data type and choose the required data types for each column. Click Next. 7. In the Target form, select the Engine, Catalog, and Schema in which the table is created. 8. Enter a name for the table in the Table name field and click Next. 9. Verify the details in the Summary page and scroll down to view the DDL preview. 10. Click Create. 11. Verify that the table creation status in the Result set is successful, indicated as true. 12. Go to the Data manager page and select the schema under which you created the table and click the refresh icon. The newly created table is listed.

The MLS All-Star Game is an annual soccer game featuring select players from Major League Soccer. It originally started with a traditional East vs. West format, but later evolved into inviting a club from abroad to play against a league all-star team. Players are awarded roster spots through a combination of fan voting and selections by the appointed manager and league commissioner. The game takes place during the middle of the MLS season, which coincides with the pre-seasons of most European leagues. The MLS All-Stars have an 8-4 record in the competition as of 2015.

In the United States, it is known as soccer. Some other countries also call it soccer, but in most parts of the world, it is called football. Sports commonly called football in certain places include association football ( known as soccer in some countries ) ; gridiron football ( specifically American football or Canadian football ) ; Australian rules football ; rugby football ( either rugby league or rugby union ) ; and Gaelic football .

Yes, women's association football, also commonly known as women's football or women's soccer, is the most prominent team sport for women worldwide. In the 1970s, Italy became the first country to have professional women's football players on a part-time basis. An Italian women's football federation, known as Federazione Femminile Italiana Gioco Calcio or FFIGC, ran a "World Championships" tournament in Rome supported by the Martini and Rossi wine manufacturers, entirely without the involvement of FIFA or any of the common national associations.

The World Cup is the world's most prestigious association football tournament and has the highest television audience of any sport, making it the most popular event globally. In terms of viewership, it exceeds even the Olympic Games. On the other hand, American football is the most popular sport in the United States, with 1.1 million high school football players and nearly 70,000 college football players.

The origins of modern football codes can be traced back to Western Europe, particularly England. In 1409, King Henry IV of England made one of the earliest documented uses of the English word "football" when he issued a proclamation forbidding the levying of money for "foteball". FIFA acknowledges England as the birthplace of club football. The Football Association, established in 1863 by Ebenezer Cobb Morley, is recognized as the oldest football association, with the first set of football rules being drafted at that time.
Yes, American football evolved in the United States from the sports of association football (known in the U.S. as soccer) and rugby football.

The National Football League (NFL) has the highest average attendance of any sports league in the world, and the Super Bowl is watched by millions globally. American football is played in European countries such as Switzerland, which has American football clubs in every major city, and Germany, where the sport has around 45,000 registered amateur players. In Europe, almost all nations have their leagues, highlighting its importance, such as Austria (Austrian Football League), Germany (German Football League), Great Britain (BAFA National Leagues), France (Ligue Élite de Football Américain), and Italy (Italian Football League). However, American football has not yet reached the same level of popularity it has in, for example, North America. Football organizers are targeting Europe to expand the game.

Yes, both sports originated from the older game of rugby football in the 19th century. British colonists and the British military introduced football to North America, where it became popular in American and Canadian universities and prep schools. At that time, association football and rugby football were not as distinct as they are now, and teams would negotiate the rules before each game. It's possible to compare American football and rugby league because they share origins and similar game concepts. Along with Canadian football, the rugby league is the sport most similar to American football. Both sports involve a limited number of downs or tackles, and scoring touchdowns or tries takes precedence over goal-kicking.
The football league consists of 32 teams.

No, they are not the same. A mortgage is a secured debt consisting of a promissory note and a security interest that provides the mortgage holder with a secured interest in the property. A mortgage is a loan backed by a property, as specific laws cover it due to its wide usage. Therefore, the bank is not an "investor" in your house; it is simply lending you money with the property as collateral. Thus, it does not receive any share of the profit. On the other hand, refinancing, or re-fi, occurs when a debtor takes out a new loan, usually with new bank, to pay off an old one. This can be done for various reasons, primarily because the new loan terms will result in a lower monthly payment.

Ideally, a 20% down payment is suggested when buying a house. The idea behind this is that if someone can't save 1/5 of the cost of a house, they might not be responsible enough to ensure loan repayment. Additionally, by putting down 20%, you can avoid paying costly private mortgage insurance (PMI).

You can obtain various types of insurance, each with commendable rules. If you require a specific kind of insurance, the insurance company can offer it to you. Homeowners insurance helps to protect against the potential devastation of a catastrophic event, which could otherwise wipe out a large portion of our net worth. For many individuals, a fully paid-off house represents their most significant asset, often more valuable than all other savings combined. It's a risk that most people would prefer to avoid.

Renting vs. buying: There are advantages to buying, such as that instead of money going towards rent, with a mortgage, some of the payment goes towards interest, but you are also building equity. Eventually, you'll pay off the mortgage and can live rent-free. Buying with a 20% down payment can give you a strong position in the market. If you have the financial ability to assume the risk of owning, you may be better off. On the other hand, renting provides flexibility to move with minimum hassle, and the landlord assumes the risk of owning the property. Buying is sometimes better than renting, even if you're not mobile; that depends on local market conditions. If you're investing the money reasonably, you may do as well as or better than a homebuyer, and your funds will be significantly more liquid.

A home is an investment, but the value it provides isn't primarily financial. Instead, it offers consumption value as a place to live. This sets it apart from other types of investments. While you may experience some capital gains, typically in line with inflation, they are not guaranteed, and it's not easy to realize them without selling the house and moving. Essentially, there are two ways to benefit from an appreciating asset like a home: (a) Sell it and take the profit. However, if you still need a place to live, this doesn't really benefit you unless you buy a cheaper home to replace it.

Gift taxes kick in at around $14K per giver per recipient per year. That means a straight-up gift of $200K (as cash or a house) will incur a tax. If the father has a spouse, he and the spouse could each give the mother and each child the total gift limit. Put the house in your name right from the get-go. He gives you the money, but you sign over a promissory note to him so that you net less than $14000 (gift tax annual exclusion for the calendar year). He can give everyone in your household 14k per year tax-free, which he could give you and your partner in less than seven years.

Mortgage holders sign a promissory note, a promise to pay. But the contract explicitly details the penalty for nonpayment — surrender of the property. The borrower isn't escaping the consequences; he is suffering them from a purely financial standpoint. If you look at the downsides of walking away, The issues with the credit rating are well known, but you need to consider any open lines of credit you currently have and any need you might have to open a line of credit in the future. 401(k) and IRA accounts are not at risk when you default on a mortgage, even in states that aren't non-recourse. The bank cannot go after you in states where mortgages are non-recourse loans. They get the keys, and whatever they recover from the house sale is it.

Generally, you need to be of legal age (usually 18) to apply for a loan. Also, your credit score should be good enough for the bank or loan company to feel comfortable lending you money. The reason for the age requirement is that if you're not 18, any contract you sign can be canceled (made invalid) by either you or your parents. This means that it would be legal for you to ask the bank for a $1000 loan and for the bank to provide it, if you're under 18.

The choice between a 15-year and 30-year mortgage depends on your financial situation and goals. A 15-year mortgage will typically have a lower interest rate and you'll pay off your house faster, but your monthly payments will be higher. A 30-year mortgage will have higher interest rates and you'll pay more in interest over the life of the loan, but your monthly payments will be lower. If you can afford the higher monthly payments, a 15-year mortgage may be a good choice to save money in the long run. However, if you need the lower monthly payments to afford a house, a 30-year mortgage may be a better option.

The Penobscot River originates from four branches in various lakes in north-central Maine. It specifically begins where the West Branch meets the East Branch at Medway. The river flows into the Atlantic Ocean at Penobscot Bay, and historically served as an important trade route from the Atlantic coast to interior Maine.

The West Branch is home to many types of fish, such as landlocked salmon and brook trout. There are many deep pools within the river due to the many slate ledges, making the river ideal for fishing from shore, although there are still areas that are good for canoe fishing. The West Branch is a world-class landlocked salmon river, while the East Branch is known for its smallmouth bass fishery. In 2008, the Atlantic Salmon Commission opened the main stem of the river to catch and release fly fishing for Atlantic salmon.

Yes, Main has the Androscoggin River, a 178-mile river located in the U.S. states of Maine and New Hampshire in northern New England. It joins the Kennebec River at Merrymeeting Bay in Maine before flowing into the Gulf of Maine on the Atlantic Ocean. The river is a popular fishing destination, offering opportunities to catch brook, rainbow, brown trout, landlocked salmon, and smallmouth bass.

The "best" river for fishing depends on the specific type of fish being pursued and the angler's preferences. The Yellowstone River is considered one of the world's greatest trout streams. It is officially classed as a blue ribbon stream in Montana from the park to the confluence with the Boulder River east of Livingston and from the mouth of Rosebud Creek near Rosebud, Montana, to the North Dakota border.  The Snake River was once one of the most important rivers for the spawning of anadromous fish -- which are hatched in the headwaters of rivers, live in the ocean for most of their lives, and return to the river to spawn -- in the United States.

No. The Snake River is the thirteenth longest river in the United States. The longest river is the Mississippi River, the chief river of the second-largest drainage system on the North American continent, second only to the Hudson Bay drainage system. Using the longest stream as the source, Brower's Spring in Montana, the source of the Missouri River, would give it an incredible length of 3,710 miles, making it the fourth longest river in the world after the Nile, Amazon, and Yangtze. If we use the Largest Stream measurement, the Ohio River, and by extension the Allegheny River would be the source, and the Mississippi would begin in Pennsylvania.
The Mississippi River is the chief river of the second-largest drainage system on the North American continent and is the longest river in the United States.

The Amazon River is located in the America continent, also called the Americas, and is the largest river basin in the world, covering about 40% of South America with an area of approximately 7,050,000 square kilometers (2,722,020 sq mi). It flows from west to east, starting from Iquitos in Peru and continuing across Brazil to the Atlantic. The river runs mainly through Brazil and Peru and is part of the border between Colombia and Peru. With an average discharge of about 209,000 cubic meters per second (7,400,000 cu ft/s), the Amazon represents 20% of the global riverine discharge to the ocean, greater than the combined discharge of the following seven largest independent rivers.

There are several navigable rivers in the United States. For instance, the Penobscot River becomes navigable at the city of Bangor. Additionally, both the Mississippi River and the Missouri River are commercially navigable along their entire lengths in Missouri.

Yes, the Hudson River is considered an important river in the United States. The 315-mile-long Hudson River flows through eastern New York, serving as a boundary between New Jersey and New York. The region has experienced economic revitalization, especially in green development. Notable projects such as the High Line and the Walkway Over the Hudson, along with waterfront parks and annual festivals, contribute to the area's appeal. The Hudson River valley runs primarily from north to south down the eastern edge of New York State, cutting through a series of rock types including Triassic sandstones and redbeds in the south, and much more ancient Precambrian gneiss in the north (and east).

There are several risks you might be taking if your friend puts your name down for a house he's buying.  Firstly, if you are co-signing the mortgage, the risk is that you will owe the bank the principal amount of the mortgage if your friend is unable to pay. You could come out of it a lot poorer and with your credit rating wrecked. Secondly, if you are not on the deed of the house, you would not have any legal rights to the property. This means that your friend could sell the house without your consent and you would still be responsible for the mortgage.  Thirdly, if your friend's house is a second home, he may not qualify for mortgage assistance or relief, increasing the risk for you as a co-signer.    Lastly, anyone considering this approach to talk to a lawyer and be aware of the potential tax implications.

Yes, being a veteran can help to get a mortgage. There are mortgages available specifically for veterans, such as VA loans, which offer low-to-no down payment and attractive rates. However, in a seller's market, buyers with VA loans may face challenges as some sellers might prefer offers with fewer barriers.  VA loans are not always a great deal for that matter and conventional tends to be the best including FHA. The veterans sometimes can  make themselves more appealing to sellers with non-VA loans.

FHA is an insurance policy to the bank saying that if you default they will cover a high percentage of the loan. An FHA loan has several benefits. Firstly, it only requires a 3.5% down payment and allows for lower credit scores compared to traditional mortgages. This makes it a viable option for first-time homebuyers or those with limited credit history. Secondly, the PMI costs associated with FHA loans can be reduced by the size of the down payment. However, it's important to note that FHA loans require mortgage insurance premiums (MIP) for the life of the loan, which can increase the overall cost of the mortgage.

Whether or not you need a real estate agent depends on your individual needs and circumstances. In the United States, the seller typically pays the real estate agent fee. If you don't have an agent, you may miss out on their expertise in explaining contract terms, advising you on making offers, the option to do inspections. While you can technically complete a real estate transaction without an agent, it's strongly advised to have one to guide you through the process and help you avoid potential pitfalls.

To become a real estate agent, you would typically need to take a pre-licensing course from a certified provider within your state, pass a licensing exam, and then complete a certain number of hours of post-licensing education. As for whether it pays, real estate agents typically make a commission of 3% to 3.5% of the sale price of a property, which can vary depending on the location and the sale price. However, earnings can be unpredictable and depend on various factors such as the number of transactions and the sale prices of the properties. And they only get paid if the house sells.

The decision between buying and renting a home is a complex one that depends mostly on what makes economic sense. Pros of buying: - Building equity: When you buy a home, some of your monthly payment goes towards building equity in the property. - Tax benefits: Mortgage interest and property taxes are tax-deductible. - Freedom to customize: When you own a home, you have the freedom to customize it to your liking. - Stability: Owning a home can provide a sense of stability and security. Cons of buying: - Upfront costs: Buying a home typically requires a significant down payment and closing costs. - Maintenance and repairs: Homeowners are responsible for maintenance and repairs. A lot depends on how much of that you do yourself - Lack of mobility: buying only makes sense if you stay in the house for 5 years or more. Pros of renting: Rent. If you have no idea whether you will still be in the same part of the country five years from now - Lower upfront costs: Renting typically requires less upfront costs compared to buying. - No responsibility for maintenance and repairs. Cons of renting: - No equity building. - Rent increases: Rents can increase over time. - Limited customization: Renters typically have limited ability to customize their living space. Consider your individual needs, circumstances, and financial situation when making the decision between buying and renting.

A home is the first and best investment where you build a life, but the value it returns isn't primarily.  It's not like a stock or bond that you hold for a little while and then cash out for the profit.  You can own a home with as little as 3% down and as you pay for your living you pay it off.   Others argue that it is not a good investment because it is a single, indivisible, undiversified, and illiquid asset, and its value is tied to the local economy, which can lead to losses during a recession and housing bust. It is an expense/liability/asset. Therefore, whether a home is a good investment or not depends on various factors and individual financial goals.

The key to good investing is you need to understand what you are investing in. It is a good idea to buy stock in good companies but that is not sufficient. You need to buy stock in good companies at good prices. That means you need to understand things like price to earnings, price to revenue and price to book. The question about what is a better investment is subjective, something you invest in has the ability to grow in value. So examples of investments would be buying stocks, bonds, currencies and commodities. When it comes down to it, long-term investments pay better than short-term ones. If nothing else, there's less administration and less financial risk for the provider. Stocks, bonds, and mutual funds offer diversification, liquidity, and potential for higher returns, but also come with market risk and volatility. It's essential to consult with a financial advisor.

Yes, common stocks and preferred stocks have differences in terms of what they represent per unit. Common stocks typically represent ownership in a company and usually come with voting rights. On the other hand, preferred stocks usually do not come with voting rights but offer more consistent dividends and have a higher claim on assets and earnings than common stocks in case of liquidation. However, neither common nor preferred stocks necessarily represent a specific percentage of the company per unit, as the value of each share can vary based on factors such as the company's performance and market conditions.
Preferred stocks are traded on the market, similar to common stocks. You can buy them using a brokerage account.

Purchasing stock doesn't affect your immediate taxes, however, selling stock has tax effects; if you sell the stocks for a profit, you will have a capital gain, which is subject to capital gains tax. If you sell them for a loss, you can use that to offset other capital gains or potentially deduct a certain amount from your taxable income.  It would be beneficial to consult with a tax professional or financial advisor to understand the tax implications better. Regarding the "zero dividend preference shares," they are designed to deliver gains as capital gains rather than income. This feature can be useful for tax efficiency, especially when making use of the annual capital gains tax allowance. However, these types of shares may have gone out of fashion due to a scandal around the year 2000.

Designating stocks into a trust can have different tax and legal implications depending on the type of trust and the jurisdiction. Generally, the trust becomes the owner of the assets, and any income generated by the stocks would be reported under the trust's tax identification number.  Interest in Possession Trusts and Income Tax Trustees are responsible for declaring and paying Income Tax on income received by the trust. The tax rate depends on the type of income, for example, in the 2014 to 2015 tax year, UK dividends are taxed at the dividend ordinary rate of 10%.

In the US, short-term capital gains and ordinary dividends are presently taxed at the same rates. The Bush tax cuts reduced the dividend tax rate from 28% to 15-20% but in 2011 budget resolution included an increase in the top tax rate on dividends to 39.6%.    At the individual level, depending on the State, most people are taxed at the regular income rate typically 25-33%.

Yes, there are provisions for losses in stock trading. If you have incurred a loss, you can take advantage of it through tax loss harvesting. This involves selling the stock at a loss and then buying it back after a 30-day waiting period. The loss can be used to offset other capital gains or potentially deduct a certain amount from your taxable income. It's important to note that there are rules and limitations to this strategy, such as the wash sale rule, which prohibits repurchasing the same or a substantially identical security within 30 days before or after the sale.

The choice between the First-In-First-Out (FIFO) and Last-In-First-Out (LIFO) methods for determining which shares are sold first when you sell shares of a stock you own can have different tax implications. Under the FIFO method, the oldest shares are considered sold first and pay lower capital gains tax rate instead of the short term marginal rate.  Under the LIFO method, the most recently acquired shares are sold first.    If you're selling at loss and have other short term gains, you would probably be better selling LIFO, so that the loss could offset other short term gains that you might have.  The default is FIFO.

Yes, the choice between FIFO and LIFO can indeed complicate the bookkeeping process.  If you instruct your broker to sell shares purchased in specific lots, they can do that.  Brokers now are required to keep track of cost basis and report it to the IRS on the 1099-B.  Also, business bookkeeping services may help you in all aspect of managing your accounts and financial data within the accounting software such as QuickBooks, MYOB, and Peachtree.

Yes, being active can positively influence children's academic performance. Children who get enough physical activity tend to have an easier time focusing, perform better on tests, and exhibit improvements in memory, flexible thinking, and self-control. Encouraging kids to participate in sports or family activities that involve movement can contribute to these benefits as kids need physical activity to grow up strong and healthy.  A good night of sleep also help their mood and  get better grades.

Yes, physical activity can increase a child's attention span. Children who get enough physical activity often find it easier to focus, which can lead to better test performance and improved memory, flexible thinking, and self-control. Encouraging children to engage in regular physical activity, such as sports or family games that involve movement, can contribute to these benefits.

It is recommended that children should get at least one hour of physical activity each day. This can include activities like running, biking, hiking, or assisting with chores, as well as indoor exercises. Regular physical activity can help children perform better in school, sleep better, and improve their mood.

To help prevent child obesity, encourage your kids to engage in regular physical activity for at least one hour a day. This can include various activities like running, biking, hiking, playing sports, or even helping with chores. Help  your children understand why physical activity is important. Additionally, limit their screen time and promote healthy eating habits by providing nutritious meals and snacks.

Here are the types and causes of male and female infertility: Male infertility can be caused by: 1. Low semen quality 2. Endocrine problems 3. Drugs 4. Radiation 5. Infection 6. Testicular malformations 7. Hormone imbalance 8. Blockage of the duct system 9. Primary ciliary dyskinesia 10. Antisperm antibodies Female infertility can be caused by: 1. Inability to ovulate 2. Malformation of the eggs 3. Polycystic ovarian syndrome 4. Failure of ovaries to mature and release eggs 5. Ovulatory problems These causes can be diagnosed and, in some cases, treated through medical intervention. However, in about 10-20% of cases, no cause is found.
The documents do not include information on how long to consider adoption after experiencing infertility.

The documents do not include information about regional differences in infertility types and causes. It is important to note that  existing definitions of infertility lack uniformity , rendering comparisons in prevalence between countries or over time problematic .

The documents do not provide specific information about the impact of chemotherapy on fertility before puberty.   But, yes, chemotherapy can affect fertility.  It can cause DNA damaging of the cells in the testicles or ovaries that produce sperm and eggs, potentially leading to reduced fertility or even sterility.

While chemotherapy can impact fertility, there are options available to preserve fertility before starting treatment, such as sperm or egg freezing; eggs may be frozen and stored for later use.  For semen, cryopreservation can be used for far longer storage durations like 21 yrs.  However, these options may not be suitable for everyone, especially those who have not yet reached puberty.  It's important to discuss the potential risks and available options with a healthcare provider before starting chemotherapy.

In most countries where it is legal and compensated , the law places a cap on the compensation and that cap tends to be in the vicinity of $1000 -- $2000 .  The European Union limits any financial compensation for donors to at most $1500.  In the US , they are paid thousands of dollars.  The American Society for Reproductive Medicine ( ASRM ) requires member clinics to abide by ASRM standards that sums of $5,000 or more require justification and sums above $10,000 are not appropriate.   It's also important to note that such programs aim to help individuals and couples struggling with infertility and should prioritize their well-being above any commercial interests.

Yes, egg donation is typically organized through agencies or fertility clinics, rather than being arranged through individual contracts with recipients.  Though the donors may motivated by altruistic reasons, they still have to operate with an economical mind - set.   These organizations facilitate the process, ensuring that all legal and ethical guidelines are followed, and that both the donor and recipient rights are protected. They also provide support and counseling throughout the process.

To report a scam, you can report the incident to TIGTA and to phishing@irs.gov (Subject: FAX). Additionally, if you have been a victim of monetary or identity theft, you may also file a complaint with the Internet Crime Complaint Center. If you are a U.S. citizen located in the United States or its territories or a U.S. citizen living abroad: complete the appropriate complaint form with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. Forward email to phishing@irs.gov (Subject: Stock). If you are not a U.S. citizen and reside outside the United States, complete the appropriate complaint form with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. Contact your securities regulator and file a complaint. Forward email to phishing@irs.gov (Subject: Stock).

The best way to avoid being a victim of spam texts and emails, it is  never share your personal information, especially your Social Security number, with someone who reaches out to you unexpectedly. Unsubscribe from unwanted emails to reduce the chances of clicking on links that could lead to a phishing attack. Also report unwanted messages using your phone's "report junk" option or forwarding them to 7726 (SPAM) for texts and to your email provider for unwanted emails. Educate yourself by  learning more about how to get fewer spam texts and emails.  If you spot a scam, report it to the FTC at ReportFraud.ftc.gov. Additionally, before entering personal information on a website, email, or text chain, stop and ask yourself why they need this information and what's going to happen to it. Always be cautious when dealing with unsolicited messages.

Lottery and sweepstakes scams are one of the most common consumer frauds operating today.  You get a card, call, or email telling you that you won. Then  they tell you there is a fee, some taxes, or customs duties to pay. They ask for your bank account information, or ask you to send money via a wire transfer or to purchase gift cards and provide the card numbers. Government Impostor scams  are also very common : You get a text, call, or email from someone who says they are with the government. They may claim to be a U.S. Marshal, saying you must pay a fine for missing jury duty. Or the IRS, saying that you owe thousands in back taxes. Another scam that you must be alert occurs  when someone gets an email or most often a phone call and the caller begins speaking very quickly about common computer issues that slow performance or even potential hacks to your system. There are imposter scammers  that try to convince you to send money by pretending to be someone you know or trust like a sheriff, local, state, or federal government employee, or charity organization. Today, phishing  is very common . the scammer  impersonates a business or a person to trick you into giving out your personal information, such as passwords, credit card numbers, or bank account information. A scammer may use fraudulent emails, texts, or websites to steal this information from you.

Mortgage scams are schemes that can take your money, your house by making a false promise of saving you from foreclosure. These scammers may ask for money upfront and claim to guarantee that you can get your mortgage terms changed. To prevent those scams, you can use a fraud alert , reducing the chance to be a victim of new account identity theft. This way, creditors must check your credit report to take steps to verify your identity before opening a new account, issuing an additional card, or increasing the credit limit on an existing account.

Indeed scammer target everyone but some vulnerable ones like older adults and senior citizens are often more their victims . The imposter scammers try to convince those people to send money by pretending to be someone they know or trust like a sheriff, local, state, or federal government employee, or charity organization. Residence is targeted by Contractors. The contractors may offer to perform a free inspection, then claim that a serious problem such as faulty wiring, bad plumbing, or a leaky roof, will put you in danger.

Yes, indeed scammers also do target individuals during tax season with the intention of defrauding them. In fact the IRS and Security Summit partners alert taxpayers to be on the lookout for unscrupulous tax preparers who could encourage people to file false tax returns and steal valuable personal information. The Internal Revenue Service  warns taxpayers as well about groups masquerading as charitable organizations to attract donations from unsuspecting contributors. Additionally the IRS  alerts the taxpayers to stay away from "helpful" scammers offering to set up an Online Account IR-2024-87. IRS advises to watch out for  scammers attempting to sell or offer help setting up an Online Account on IRS.gov.  and be aware of evolving phishing and smishing scams designed to steal sensitive taxpayer information.

Scammers not only target individuals but also companies. For instance there are a lot schemes involving W-2s IR-2017-10. The IRS, states and Tax Industry Renew alert about Form W-2 Scam targeting Payroll, Human Resource Departments , Schools, Restaurants, Hospitals and also tribal groups. Since 2016, phishing@irs.gov has received emails from organizations that have been targeted by the business email compromise (BEC) / business email spoofing (BES) W-2 scam. There are multiple variants of this scam (e.g., fake invoice, gift card, wire transfer, title/escrow, etc.) .
The scammers send fake package shipment and delivery notifications to try to steal people's personal information not just at the holidays, but all year long.

It is important to note that trading stocks involves significant risk, and it is not recommended to invest money that you are not prepared to lose. Pump-and-dump scams are indeed very real, but the scale of a single scam isn't anywhere near the type of heist you see in movies like Trading Places. Stock market is like poker: you don't take the same risks when it is fake money and thus you don't learn the same lessons from your mistakes. Picking individual stocks and hoping for the value to go up in a relatively short time-frame is similar to gambling (rule #0: use only money that you don't need). Therefore, it is crucial to educate yourself and be smart when engaging in stock trading.

Choosing and investing in only one stock is risky. You can lower your risk by diversifying, or investing in lots of different stocks. That means investing in a mutual fund or Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs). Mutual funds, offer diversification, which can help spread risk. Index-based mutual funds invest in a broad range of securities including both stocks and bonds. I would recommend sticking to mutual funds and saving accounts for most investors.

An ETF is an ""Exchange Traded Fund"". It trades like a stock, on the stock market. Basically by buying one ETF, you can have ownership in the underlying companies that make up the ETF. An ETF does not track any one individual stock. It is a marketable security that tracks an index, a commodity, bonds, or a basket of assets like an index fund. ETFs can be a cost-effective way to gain exposure to a broad portfolio of investments. Like mutual funds, ETFs can offer diversification, which can help spread risk. However, unlike mutual funds, ETFs have a higher liquidity and they can be traded at any time during the trading hours.

The minimum investment for mutual funds can vary depending on the fund, but it is often around $2000. However, $5000 isn't enough to give you much flexibility in achieving a balanced portfolio. For ETFs, you can invest in funds with a minimum amount subject to the fund's requirements. Keep in mind that buying and selling ETFs will cost you a commission, typically around 2-3% of your investment. When investing small amounts, you should consider the substantial toll that commissions will take on your investment. It is recommended to have at least $5000 to invest in stocks or ETFs to minimize the impact of commissions. If you have a smaller amount to invest, you might consider a Vanguard mutual fund, which will not charge commissions and will have annual expenses only slightly higher than the corresponding ETF.

Staying invested in stock market over the long term will almost always be profitable if you spread your investments across different companies or even the index but the key here is long term which is 10+ years. Long term data shows 40 years worth of investing put the investor far ahead. Even a retiree is still a long term investor as life spans of 90 are common. The concept of "long-term investing" can vary depending on the context and the individual investor's financial goals. Generally, 5 years is a reasonable time period to invest in a stock.

It is generally recommended to start as early as possible. Everyone thinks that they don't make enough to start saving. Don't put it off. Save some money out of each paycheck even if it is only $50. Now for the bad news. $1mm is not enough to retire on. The general rule of thumb is that you should have 25x your annual expenses saved when you retire. The only time to stop saving money for retirement is when you have enough money to retire tomorrow. Remember: you are likely to live to 100, so you better save enough to live that long. I don't trust social security to be there. 35 is not mid-life. You're on the tail end of the age to get started on retirement planning. There's a table on one of the FIRE (Financial Independent, Retire Early) websites that shows a graph between % of income saved and the number of years it takes to save enough to be financially independent.

Retirement income is taxed as ordinary income. If you get a lump sum payment out of the pension, when you retire, you will be taxed. In retirement your income may be structured completely differently than when you are working. For example, you may also have a Roth IRA/401K to pull from. Traditional IRA and 401(k) contributions are made pre-tax, and withdrawals in retirement are taxed as ordinary income. Roth IRA and Roth 401(k) are the opposite: you pay income tax up front before putting money into the retirement account, but you will eventually withdraw without paying any additional tax at that time.
No, encrypted images are not scanned by Vulnerability Advisor.

Vulnerability Advisor scans images that are stored in IBM Cloud Container Registry to find potential security vulnerabilities in the image content. It checks for known software vulnerabilities and weak system configurations. Also, it detects security issues and potential vulnerabilities. When it finds any issues, it provides suggestions to help fix the reported vulnerabilities.

Vulnerability Advisor v4 is now available, and you should update Vulnerability Advisor to version 4 by 19 June 2023. If you use one of the Vulnerability Advisor version 3 SDKs to access Vulnerability Advisor, you must update to the Vulnerability Advisor version 4 SDK.
About how to update to version 4, see Update Vulnerability Advisor to version 4 by 19 June 2023.

Vulnerability Advisor version 4 uses new architecture and a different scanning engine compared to version 3. In version 4, the image is indexed the first time it is pushed and the vulnerability assessment is calculated every time Vulnerability Advisor is queried about that image. In contrast, version 3 triggers the scanning of an image when a new image is pushed to the registry, when a new security notice is released for a package that is installed in the image, or while an image is tagged in the registry. Additionally, version 3 is deprecated from 19 June 2023 and it is recommended to update to version 4.

You can protect the confidentiality of your IBM Cloud® Container Registry images, and ensure that hosts that aren't trusted can't run the images. You can create an encrypted image by using an RSA public-private key pair to encrypt and decrypt the image. The public key is used to encrypt the image, while a private key is a secret and then build a container image by using a Dockerfile, and only users that have that private key can use it to decrypt the image.

Yes, of course! IBM Cloud® Container Registry is integrated with the Security and Compliance Center to help you manage security and compliance for your organization. It provides a multi-tenant, highly available, scalable, and encrypted private image registry. It allows you to store and access your private container images, and it is hosted and managed by IBM. You can use Container Registry by setting up your own image namespace and pushing container images to your namespace. This service is required if you are using Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud.

You can authorize a user to configure the registry by adding a second user to your account and grant them the ability to configure IBM Cloud Container Registry. Also, you can authorize a user to access specific namespaces by creating some namespaceswith sample images, and grant access to them. You create policies to grant different roles to each namespace, and show what effect that has.

To set up namespaces in IBM Cloud Container Registry, you can follow these steps: 1. Choose a unique namespace name that meets the requirements (4-30 characters, starts and ends with a letter or number, contains lowercase letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores only). Avoid putting personal information in your namespace names. 2. Run the `ibmcloud cr namespace-add` command followed by your desired namespace name to create a new namespace. 3. Verify the creation of the new namespace by running the `ibmcloud cr namespace-list` command. Remember that you can have up to 100 namespaces in each region, and if you're unsure whether a namespace is already set for your account, you can run the `ibmcloud cr namespace-list` command with the `-v` option to retrieve existing namespace information.

To update the cluster master, you should follow these steps:
1. Check if your cluster is unsupported by reviewing the State field in the output of the `ibmcloud ks cluster ls` command or in the IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service console.
2. If your cluster is unsupported, you need to create a new cluster and deploy your apps to the new cluster. Then, you can delete the unsupported cluster.
3. Before updating to the latest version, make sure to update deprecated clusters to a supported version that is one or two behind the current version. For example, you can update to version 1.21 or 1.22 before updating to the latest version, 1.23.
4. If the worker nodes run a version two or more behind the master, update them to the same version as the master to avoid issues with your pods.
5. Finally, update the cluster using the instructions provided in the IBM Cloud documentation: <https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/containers?topic=containers-updateupdate>.
Keep in mind that updating a cluster to a new version may impact deployed apps, so it's essential to prepare accordingly.

The CIS Kubernetes Benchmark is a framework of specific steps to configure Kubernetes more securely and with standards that are commensurate to various industry regulations. It is published by the Center for Internet Security (CIS). When a new Kubernetes version is released, IBM engineers compare the default configuration of a cluster that runs that Kubernetes version against the benchmark and publishes the results in the IBM Cloud documentation. The benchmark recommendations are provided by the Center for Internet Security, and it covers recommendations for master components, etcd, control plane configurations, worker nodes, and policies such as for users, network, and pod security.

No, you can deploy IBM Cloud® Kubernetes Service clusters worldwide, not just in the USA. Cloud Kubernetes Service is available in a subset of these locations, including worldwide multizone regions and single zone regions.

Here are some best practices for using IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service: 1. Keep your cluster up-to-date: Regularly update your cluster to avoid getting into an unsupported state and experiencing operational impact. 2. Ensure compatibility between master and worker nodes: Your worker nodes can't run a later major.minor Kubernetes version than the master. They can be up to two versions behind the master version (n-2). 3. Update worker nodes for each patch version: Unlike the master, you must update your workers for each patch version. 4. Review the version archive instructions: If your cluster runs an unsupported Kubernetes version, follow the version archive instructions.

Kubernetes is an open source platform for managing containerized workloads and services across multiple hosts, and offers managements tools for deploying, automating, monitoring, and scaling containerized apps with minimal to no manual intervention.

Your containerized apps are hosted on IBM Cloud infrastructure compute hosts that are called worker nodes. You can choose to provision your compute hosts as virtual machines with shared or dedicated resources, or as bare metal machines that can be optimized for GPU and software-defined storage (SDS) usage. Your worker nodes are controlled by a highly available Kubernetes master that is configured, monitored, and managed by IBM. You can use the IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service API or CLI to work with your cluster infrastructure resources and the Kubernetes API or CLI to manage your deployments and services. IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service is a managed Kubernetes offering that provides powerful tools, an intuitive user experience, and built-in security for rapid delivery of apps that you can bind to cloud services related to IBM Watson, AI, IoT, DevOps, security, and data analytics. It offers features like intelligent scheduling, self-healing, horizontal scaling, service discovery and load balancing, automated rollouts and rollbacks, and secret and configuration management. Additionally, it has advanced capabilities around simplified cluster management, container security and isolation policies, the ability to design your own cluster, and integrated operational tools for consistency in deployment.

To secure your cluster in IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service, you can use built-in security features to protect various components such as the Kubernetes API server, etcd data store, worker node, network, storage, images, and deployments against malicious attacks. These features help ensure security compliance and data integrity. Additionally, you can leverage built-in logging and monitoring tools to detect malicious attacks and suspicious usage patterns. As for access policies, IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service uses Cloud Identity and Access Management (IAM) to grant access to cluster resources through IAM platform access roles and Kubernetes role-based access control (RBAC) policies through IAM service access roles. The access policies that you assign users depend on what you want your users to be able to do. You can find more information about what roles authorize which types of actions on the User access reference page or in the following table's links. For steps to assign policies, see Granting users access to your cluster through IBM Cloud IAM.

IBM Cloud Kubernetes Service concurrently supports multiple versions of Kubernetes. However, when a new version (n) is released, versions up to 2 behind (n-2) are supported. If you need support on worker node operated systems by cluster version, please see the Kubernetes version information. Certain VPC worker node flavors offer GPU support. For more information, see the VPC flavors.

Assuming the question is about the IBM Cloud® Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) command line interface (CLI),  version 6.15.0 includes the following changes over version 6.14.0. It introduces new commands image-obsolete and image-deprecate for image lifecycle management. It also adds support for image lifecycle management in image-create, image-update, and images commands and it fixes an issue with using the SSH key generated from UI in CLI.

The new commands introduced in version 6.15.0 of the IBM Cloud® Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) command line interface (CLI) are image-obsolete and image-deprecate. These commands support image lifecycle management, allowing users to manage the lifecycle of their custom images more effectively. The image-obsolete command can be used to mark an image as obsolete, indicating that it is no longer available to be used to provision an instance. The image-deprecate command can be used to mark an image as deprecated, discouraging its use before it becomes obsolete.

To use the new `image-obsolete` and `image-deprecate` commands, you need to specify the name or ID of the custom image with the `IMAGE` variable.  To mark an image as deprecated, use the following command:  ```  ibmcloud is image-deprecate IMAGE  ``` - To mark an image as obsolete, use the following command:  ```  ibmcloud is image-obsolete IMAGE  ``` These commands allow you to make an immediate status change. Alternatively, you can schedule these status changes for a future date and time by using the `ibmcloud is image-update` command with the `--deprecate-at` or `--obsolete-at` options. Finally, please note that you can only make an immediate status change if a future status change is not scheduled. If you have a scheduled status change, you need to remove it first.

Yes, as I described previously, you can use the scheduling functionality to schedule a status change to obsolete and deprecated in the future using the `ibmcloud is image-update` command with the `--obsolete-at` and `--deprecate-at` options. Note, if you define both the deprecate-at and obsolete-at dates, the obsolete-at date must be after the deprecate-at date. In addition, when scheduling the date and time, you can't use your current date and time but a month and two months in the future is acceptable.
You're welcome! I'm glad I could help. Let me know if you have any other questions.
I don't have specific information about version 6.16.0 of the IBM Cloud® Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) command line interface (CLI).

There are two billing plans available: Pay-As-You-Go and Subscription. 1. Pay-As-You-Go: With this account, you're billed monthly for your resource usage. Your resource usage consists of recurring and fluctuating costs. This plan is suitable for developers or companies that want to explore the entire IBM Cloud catalog but have smaller or variable workloads. You pay only for what you use or commit to on a monthly basis, with no long-term contracts. Usage consists of products, services, and resources. 2. Subscription: With this account, you buy a subscription for an amount of credit to spend on resource usage within a certain time period. In exchange for this spending commitment, you get a discount on your usage costs.

To estimate your costs, you can use the IBM Cloud cost estimator tool. Here are the steps to follow: 1. Go to the IBM Cloud console and click on the Cost estimator icon. 2. Click on 'Create new estimate' and enter a name and description for the estimate. 3. Click on 'Create' and you will be directed to the estimate details page. 4. Click on 'Go to catalog' to add products to the estimate. 5. Select the product you are interested in and choose your pricing plan and enter any necessary configuration details. 6. Click on 'Add to estimate'. 7. Enter your estimated usage and click on 'Calculate Cost'. You can adjust the estimated usage and recalculate the cost to see how different usage levels affect the overall cost. By default, the estimator shows the pricing and billing currency set for your account. If you're estimating costs for a different location or currency, you might have to select the appropriate currency on the order summary page for the product or change the currency on your account. Once you have added all the products to your estimate, review the product details and click on 'View estimate' to see the total estimated cost.
Yes, Different types of charges apply depending on the features of IBM Cloud that you're using. The types of charges are Fixed, Metered, Tiered, and Reserved.

Sure, here are the differences among Fixed, Metered, Tiered, and Reserved charges:
1. Fixed: Fixed-rate pricing is based on an agreed upon monthly charge. If you buy an additional bare metal server, virtual server, or storage resource after the start of the monthly billing period, the cost of the resource for the first month is prorated based on the number of days remaining in the billing period. The prorated cost is billed in a separate invoice. An example of this type of charge is the fixed plans for Bare Metal Servers.
2. Metered: Metered usage is a unit-based pricing model in which you pay for what you consume. In this case, the number of GB hours that are consumed for runtimes and the number of IP addresses and storage that is consumed for containers. An example of this type of charge is the Push service, where any usage over the free monthly allowance is charged.
3. Tiered: Tiered charges add more pricing tiers, often offering discounted charges in tiers with larger consumption. Tiered pricing is offered in simple, graduated, or block. In the simple tier model, the unit price is determined by the tier that the quantity of your usage falls into. The total price is your quantity that is multiplied by the unit price in that tier. An example of this type of charge is the API Connect service, where one of the tiered plans charges $10,000 for the first 25 million monthly API calls and $40.00 USD per 100,000 API calls per month thereafter.
4. Reserved: Reserved pricing is based on a long-term commitment for a service, so you can get a discounted price. With a reserved plan, you get a dedicated service instance that is easy to set up, deploy, and deliver in the public IBM Cloud environment. An example of this type of charge is the Db2 on Cloud service, which has reserved plans.

To update your pricing plan: First, navigate to the IBM Cloud console, go to the Resource List, and select the service. Then, click on Plan in the service instance dashboard and select the pricing plan you want. Finally, click Save. However, some services might require assistance from the IBM Cloud Sales team or a migration before you can update plans. You can view your usage details from the billing and usage dashboard or from the Usage page in the console. This includes a summary of estimated charges for all services and resources used per month in your organizations. To view usage for all resources in the account, you need an access policy with the Administrator role on the Billing account management service. To view usage only for specific IBM Cloud Identity and Access Management (IAM) resources, you need the Viewer role on the resource group. To view usage only for specific Cloud Foundry services, the Billing manager role must be applied at the org level.

Based on your resource usage, there can be additional costs for support beyond the starting price. The higher your resource usage, the higher your total support cost. If you have Advanced or Premium support, you can view your monthly support costs from the Support costs page in the IBM Cloud console.

To manage your payments, you can use the [Payments](https://cloud.ibm.com/billing/payments) page in the IBM Cloud® console or go to [IBM® Billing](https://myibm.ibm.com/billing/). Depending on your account type, you may need to be assigned the operator role or higher on the billing account management service. For new US-based Pay-As-You-Go accounts with credit card billing, you can add multiple cards, replace the default card, or edit card details from the [Payments](https://cloud.ibm.com/billing/payments) page.  If you're using a payment method other than a credit card, you can switch to your payment method by going to the same page, clicking 'Payment method', selecting 'Pay with Other', and submitting a change request. Some payment methods may not be accepted as recurring payment methods and must be manually submitted each month.

To manage and view your invoices, visit the Invoices page from the billing and usage dashboard in the IBM Cloud® console. To view your invoices, you need to be assigned the operator role or higher on the billing account management service.  These are the status of invoices: Invoiced: You received the latest invoice from IBM Cloud. Paid: Your payment for the charges on your latest invoice was received. Unpaid: The charges on your latest invoice have not been paid. Pending: Your payment for your latest charges has not been applied due to a payment processing error. You can view and download your invoice from the IBM console by clicking the Download icon. The invoice is available as a simplified PDF, a detailed PDF, or as an excel spreadsheet.

You might not be able to apply a subscription code because you don't have the required access in the account or the code expired. To successfully apply a subscription code, you must have an Editor role or higher on all account management services. If the expired code needs to be reissued, you would need to contact the person who provided the code for help with reissuing a new one.

To successfully apply a feature code, you must have an Editor role or higher on all account management services. According to the provided documents, the grounds for lodging an appeal are limited to two main reasons:

1. Whether a legal mistake was made in the trial court.
2. Whether this mistake changed the final decision (called the "judgment") in the case.

In other words, the appellate court will review the trial court's decision to determine if there was an error in the application of the law to the facts of the case, and if this error affected the outcome of the case. The appellate court will not consider new evidence or retry the case, but rather review the record from the original trial to determine if a legal mistake was made.

In most cases, a party who wins an appeal can ask the other party to pay for their court costs. The Court of Appeal's opinion usually awards costs on appeal. After the court issues a remittitur (the final step in an appeal), the winning party can file a memorandum of costs in the trial court. The trial court will process the request and send notice to the parties about next steps. In some cases, a party who wins may also be able to ask the other party to pay for their attorney fees.

In a child support case, the process typically starts with opening a case with the court. You can do this by filing a petition with the court clerk's office. If you need help with the paperwork, you can ask the court's Family Law Facilitator or Self-Help Center for assistance.

Once the case is opened, you will need to serve the other parent with the court papers. The court can help you with this step.

After the other parent has been served, they will have a chance to respond to the petition. If they do not respond, the court may make a default judgment in your favor.

If the other parent does respond, the court will schedule a hearing to determine the amount of child support that should be paid. The court will consider factors such as the income of both parents, the amount of time each parent spends with the child, and the child's needs.

The court may also use a formula to calculate the amount of child support. This formula is based on the state's child support guidelines.

If you and the other parent agree on the amount of child support, you can submit a stipulation to the court for approval. If you do not agree, the court will make a decision based on the evidence presented at the hearing.

Once the court has made a decision, it will issue a child support order. This order will specify the amount of child support that must be paid, as well as how often it must be paid.

If you need help enforcing the child support order, you can contact the Local Child Support Agency (LCSA) for assistance. They can help you collect child support payments and take action against the other parent if they fail to pay.

It's also important to note that you can ask for a modification of the child support order if there is a change in circumstances, such as a change in income or the amount of time spent with the child.

If the other parent fails to pay court-ordered child support, you have several options available. In the case of willful failure to pay child support, the Department of Child Support Services (DCSS) may file contempt charges against the other parent. If found guilty of contempt, the other parent may face penalties, including a fine or jail time. However, the primary goal of the court is to ensure the payment of child support, not to punish the non-paying parent. The court may consider alternative options, such as a payment plan or community service, before imposing a jail sentence.

You can get enforcement support by contacting the local police department and asking them to enforce the order. Make sure you have a copy of the current order to give them. You can also contact the district attorney in your county, especially if you think the other parent has abducted your child. They can help you request assistance from the child abduction unit of the district attorney's office. Additionally, you can file a contempt of court case if the other parent is intentionally violating the order. You can also ask to change the order to include more details and terms that address any issues. Your court's Self-Help Center can provide more information on your options.

Spousal support, also known as alimony, is a payment made by a higher-earning spouse to a lower-earning spouse. The court may order temporary or permanent spousal support, depending on the circumstances of the case. The amount and duration of spousal support are determined by the court based on various factors, including the length of the marriage, the income and earning capacity of each spouse, and the standard of living established during the marriage. In California, the court uses a formula to calculate temporary spousal support, but the court has more discretion in determining permanent spousal support. The goal of spousal support is to provide financial assistance to the lower-earning spouse to help them maintain a similar standard of living after the divorce.

Based on the provided documents, the decision to pay off a car loan entirely or leave $1 until the end of the loan period depends on your financial goals. If you want to increase your credit score, making monthly payments and not paying off the loan immediately may be beneficial, as good payment history is reported to the credit bureau 30 days after the due date. However, this approach will result in paying more interest. If you have the funds available and want to avoid paying interest, paying off the loan entirely may be the best option. Leaving $1 until the end of the loan period may not have a significant impact on your credit score, and the loan will still appear on your credit report for 7 years.

According to the provided documents, there are five major factors that impact your credit score: 

1. Payment history: Late payments can negatively affect your score for up to seven years. It's essential to pay on time.

2. Credit utilization: This refers to how much of your available credit is in use. A lower percentage is better, but 0% isn't ideal as lenders want to see that you're using credit responsibly. Aim for 10% or less.

3. Credit history: The average age of your accounts is crucial, with older accounts being more beneficial. Avoid closing old accounts, as this can lower your average account age.

4. Credit mix: This involves the different types of credit you hold, such as loans and credit cards, as well as the number of accounts. Aiming for 6-12 accounts might be a good target, but avoid opening multiple new accounts simultaneously.

5. New credit: Credit inquiries (hard pulls) from applying for new credit can negatively impact your score. These inquiries stay on your report for two years.

FICO score and the score you see on Credit Karma are not exactly the same, although they are related.

A FICO score is a specific type of credit score developed by Fair Isaac Corporation (FICO). It's a three-digit number, ranging from 300 to 850, that lenders use to evaluate your creditworthiness. FICO scores are calculated based on the five factors I mentioned earlier (payment history, credit utilization, credit history, credit mix, and new credit).

Credit Karma, on the other hand, provides a credit score based on the VantageScore model, which is a different scoring model developed by the three major credit bureaus (Experian, Equifax, and TransUnion). VantageScore is also a three-digit number, but it ranges from 501 to 990.

While both FICO and VantageScore aim to evaluate your creditworthiness, they use slightly different formulas and weightings, so the scores may not be identical. However, they are generally similar, and a good VantageScore usually indicates a good FICO score.

Keep in mind that most lenders still use FICO scores when making lending decisions, so if you're planning to apply for a loan or credit, it's a good idea to check your FICO score specifically. But for general credit monitoring and tracking, Credit Karma's VantageScore can still provide a useful snapshot of your credit health.

The exact formulas for calculating FICO and VantageScore credit scores are proprietary and not publicly available. However, here is a general overview of how they are calculated:

FICO Score:

1. Payment history (35%): On-time payments, late payments, accounts sent to collections, and bankruptcies.
2. Credit utilization (30%): The amount of credit used compared to the amount available.
3. Length of credit history (15%): The age of the oldest account, the average age of all accounts, and the length of time since accounts were opened or closed.
4. Credit mix (10%): The variety of credit types, such as credit cards, loans, and mortgages.
5. New credit (10%): New accounts, inquiries, and credit applications.

VantageScore:

1. Payment history (40%): On-time payments, late payments, and accounts sent to collections.
2. Credit depth (21%): The age of the oldest account, the average age of all accounts, and the length of time since accounts were opened or closed.
3. Credit utilization (20%): The amount of credit used compared to the amount available.
4. Credit mix (11%): The variety of credit types, such as credit cards, loans, and mortgages.
5. New credit and credit age (8%): New accounts, inquiries, and credit applications.

Both models use data from the three major credit bureaus (Experian, Equifax, and TransUnion) to calculate the scores, which range from 300 to 850. The higher the score, the better the credit.

To get your FICO score, you can navigate to AnnualCreditReport, the official site to help consumers receive their credit report from each of the three major credit bureaus (Experian, Equifax, and TransUnion). While the free credit report does not include your FICO score, you will have the option to pay a nominal fee to receive your FICO score from each bureau. Be cautious of ads claiming to offer free FICO scores, as AnnualCreditReport is the only site backed by the FTC for safely obtaining your credit report and score.

Based on the provided documents, to troubleshoot your select query issue, follow these steps:

1. Ensure you have selected the correct database and schema in the Query editor.
2. Verify that your SQL query is correctly formatted, including the SELECT statement, FROM keyword, and any necessary clauses such as STORED AS or FIELDS TERMINATED BY.
3. Check that you have at least 'Reader' access to the buckets containing the input objects.
4. If using CSV input objects, confirm that the delimiter is correctly specified if it's not the default comma.
5. Make sure that the query is not exceeding the default maximum number of rows limit in result, or specify a limit clause in your select statement.
6. If your query contains semicolons, change the Statement separator to an ampersand (&) in the Worksheet settings to avoid errors.
7. Try clicking Clear to clear the query and then re-entering it, or click Run to re-run the query.

If you're still having issues, you may want to refer to the video tutorial mentioned in the document for more guidance on running a basic query.

A query is a request to retrieve specific data or information from a database or a data storage system. It is a way to ask the database to return a subset of data that meets certain criteria or conditions.

In the context of the provided documents, a query in IBM Cloudant is a JSON object that is passed to the db.find function, which is then sent to the _find endpoint. The query uses clauses to operate on data inside the document, and the query's selector decides which cut of data is required.

In IBM Watson Discovery, a query is a request to retrieve data from a collection after it has been ingested, indexed, and enriched. There are two main types of queries: Query and Natural Language Query (NLQ). A Query uses Discovery Query Language syntax to define the search criteria, while an NLQ accepts a text string value to find answers to queries written in natural language.

In general, a query typically consists of the following elements:

1. A request to retrieve specific data or information
2. A set of criteria or conditions that the data must meet
3. A specific format or structure for the data to be returned

Queries can be used to perform various operations, such as:

* Retrieving specific data or documents
* Filtering data based on certain criteria
* Aggregating data to perform calculations or summaries
* Sorting or ranking data based on specific criteria

Overall, queries are a powerful tool for extracting insights and information from large datasets, and are a fundamental component of many data-driven applications and systems.

To improve your query results, you can take the following actions:

1. Use the tools built into Discovery to make improvements.
2. Add quotation marks to a phrase to boost result scores, but note that results are not limited to documents that contain the entire phrase.
3. Use the query API for more control over how queries are handled.
4. Edit the stop words list to remove common words that are not useful in distinguishing the semantic meaning of the content.
5. Use cataloging to improve query performance, especially for text-based data formats.
6. Define synonyms to expand the meaning of queries beyond exact matches.
7. Provide training data, including example queries and ratings that indicate which results are relevant and not relevant.
8. Use relevancy training to improve the accuracy of query results.

Additionally, you can also try:

* Using specific keywords and phrases related to the topic you are searching for
* Avoiding vague or general terms
* Using quotes to search for exact phrases
* Using the "AND" and "OR" operators to refine your search
* Using the "NOT" operator to exclude certain terms
* Using the "site:" operator to search within a specific website or domain

By taking these steps, you can improve the accuracy and relevance of your query results.

The Query API is a REST API that allows you to submit queries to Discovery. It provides more control over how queries are handled, allowing you to specify parameters such as the query language, aggregation, and filtering. The Query API supports two types of queries: Natural Language Queries (NLQ) and Discovery Query Language (DQL) queries.

For NLQ, you can use operators such as phrase queries, which allow you to emphasize a single word or phrase in the query. For DQL, you can use operators such as JSON delimiters to separate levels of hierarchy in the JSON schema.

The Query API also allows you to specify default query settings, such as aggregation, count, and highlighting, which can be overridden using improvement tools in the user interface.

You can find more information about the Query API in the [Query reference](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/discovery-data?topic=discovery-data-query-reference) documentation.

To add or delete storage, you can increase or decrease the NFS storage capacity of your deployment by adding or deleting storage to and from a cluster. You can do this by following these steps:

1. In the VMware Solutions console, click Resources > VMware as a Service from the left navigation pane.
2. In the VMware as a Service table, click the Cloud director sites tab, then click an instance name.

To create a schema, follow these steps: 

1. Log in to IBM watsonx.data console.
2. Select Data manager from the navigation menu.
3. Select the engine from the Engine menu. The catalogs that are associated with the selected engine are displayed.
4. Click the Create drop-down and select Create schema.
5. In the Create schema form, select the catalog and enter schema name.
6. Click Create. The schema is created under the selected catalog.

To create a table, follow these steps:

1. Log in to IBM watsonx.data console.
2. From the navigation menu, select Data manager.
3. Select the engine from the Engine menu. Catalogs that are associated with the selected engine are listed.
4. Click Create and select Create table.
5. In the Create table form, drag a file to the box or click to upload.
6. Click the data type and choose the required data types for each column. Click Next.
7. In the Target form, select the Engine, Catalog, and Schema in which the table is created.
8. Enter a name for the table in the Table name field and click Next.
9. Verify the details in the Summary page and scroll down to view the DDL preview.
10. Click Create.
11. Verify that the table creation status in the Result set is successful, indicated as true.
12. Go to the Data manager page and select the schema under which you created the table and click the refresh icon. The newly created table is listed.

In aviation photography, photos of planes in the air can be taken by photographers using various methods. Specifically, air-to-air photography involves taking photos of aircraft in flight while the photographer is also in the air. In contrast, ground-to-air photography involves taking photos of aircraft in flight from the ground, often using a long focus lens to capture the image from a distance. This type of photography is commonly done at airshows or airports.

In that case, the person who takes photos of planes in the air is typically another pilot or a photographer on board another aircraft, known as the "photo platform" or "chase plane". This type of photography is called air-to-air photography.

In air-to-air photography, typically, there are two aircraft involved: one is the subject aircraft, and the other is the photo platform. The photo platform usually has a photographer on board, and a specially trained pilot who positions the aircraft to get the desired shot. The pilot may work closely with the photographer to maneuver the plane into the best position, but the photographer is usually a separate person responsible for capturing the images.

Yes, air-to-air photography is considered more challenging, especially in military aviation photography, as the photo and target aircraft often fly at high velocities and under moderate to high G-forces.

Yes, there are other types of aviation photography. They include ground-static photography, where photos of stationary aircraft are taken by photographers on the ground, and remote photography, a variation on aerial air-to-air photography, where the camera is mounted onto the external aircraft structure away from the photographer and is triggered remotely.

You can also contact the court directly for more information on the filing process and required documents.

There are several types of restraining orders, including:

1. Emergency Protective Order: Protects victims of abuse, serious harassment, or stalking and is available 24 hours a day from the police.
2. Domestic Violence Restraining Order: Protects individuals from a spouse or former spouse, person you are dating, or person you have dated, and others closely related to you.
3. Elder or Dependent Adult Abuse Restraining Order: Protects elders and dependent adults from physical and financial abuse, neglect, isolation, abduction, harm, or deprivation by a caregiver.
4. Civil Harassment Restraining Order: Protects individuals from someone you have not dated and do not have a close relationship with.
5. Workplace Violence Restraining Order: Protects employees from workplace violence or threats of violence.
6. Gun Violence Restraining Order: Allows law enforcement or family members to petition the court to temporarily remove firearms from an individual who poses a risk to themselves or others.

Each type of order has its own eligibility requirements and steps to obtain.
